As a : Customer

I want :
The release delivery to adopt Agile techniques

So that : 
I get incemental and visible results on a regular basis












When someone sends us a message with wrong event URL don't want to trigger alarm












As a service owner I want some alert that my wsdl has been deployed to the gateway and can reach my endpoints so that I know when I can begin to evaluate it

It is looking likely that the wsdl deployment will remain a manual step so this is a measure that lets the svc owner know when this has occurred
Can be
* rss update on the process flow
* an email
* a lit up thing on the web app (weakest but its early doors)






Proposal is to have a new database to add the app id and migrate the old data to the new

However, this would orphan the old data and mean that all changes to the old d/b would need to be progressed to the new in perpetuity

This story is to expolre the opportunities of sharing the new database schema between the old and new versions of Location






supporting creation of new views.

A-Z, 0-9, Space

No hyphens, underscores, etc.

Issue we are having now is some language/unicode settings send wierd chars to us which cause issues with LDAP and openssl.

Just take a look at some of the UserCertificateSubjectDN entries in LDAP -- some are completely hosed up.

Acceptance:
Tests
Clarification - What about existing applications that don't pass that rule?












Simple resilence option for CTE is to deploy several independent Ubiquity instances. Intelligent routing in JBoss required to make conversations sticky to the right instance. e.g. endCall routed to the same instance that the makeCall was handled by. This kind of resilence allows service to continue in event of a failrue but means that any active calls on the failed instance will be lost.


















A user may be able to enable or disable a gadget, currently they have to remove the gadget or deauthorize.

The experience should be that reenabling should allow the gadget to start working again and not need to obtain a new secret.

[--PSD I'm not yet convinced of this for TS day 0, deauthorizing then reauthorizing does this, OK with some pain]

Currently, if a client sets the WS-Security header to MustUnderstand=1, then on services that require User SAML, XFire will throw an exception saying it doesn\u2019t understand the Security header.  It all has to do w/ the way we process the task lists in Sentry, but it\u2019s pretty bad to get an exception like that.  What I was thinking is changing the SAML Request handler to tell XFire that it understands the WS Security Header.

I.E.:

- addCertToApp(appid, csr): X509Details

I.e:
- createApp(ownerEmail, appEmail) : status

Sometimes, during application registration, the application name will be put into LDAP but the whole process timesout before a signed cert can be returned to the user. You see a stack trace like this:

java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)...
Application with name: ElKsTestingCert already exists for owner: paul.karsten@bt.com.
com.bt.sdk.utils.PortalApplicationRegistrationException: Application with name: ElKsTestingCert already exists for owner: paul.
arsten@bt.com.
        at com.bt.sdk.utils.HttpUtil.registerApplication(Unknown Source)
        at com.bt.sdk.certtool.CertWizard$7.actionPerformed(Unknown Source)...

Need to find a more graceful way of handling this and display info to the user.






- allow app-reg requests to run as a background thread, stops them blocking.

http://mongrel.rubyforge.org/docs/distributed_worker.html






It appears anyone can re-enable an app via the portal. This is _BAD_ for production because it means anyone can re-enable the app/cert and get free services. Apps are DISABLED _AFTER_ a service invocation, not before, therefore, the call would go through, THEN the app would be disabled, but could be re-enabled via the portal. \uf04a A good hacker could easily automate this.

We need to get rid of the \u201cENABLE\u201d feature soon. Not sure if we want this for admin users or not (if we disable VIP or INTERNAL certs, admin users would just be able to go back in and re-enable them!) Customer(s) should talk.






Add the application id (as well as user id) when registering a device - using new attribute in ProfileEntity, policyEntity and sessionEntity.
Involves schema change and deployment issues.

NOTE Turn off auto update in hibernate config file before developing.

See
com.bt.sdk.capabilities.location.profile.
Profile.requestDeviceRegistration(String DeviceId)
which currently takes a DeviceId only and will now also need to take an ApplicationId.
See also ProfileFacade class.

Acceptance Criteria:-

Pretend to be fred@bt.com/app1 and request permission to see location. 

Pretend to be jack@bt.com/app1 and accept pretend to be fred@bt.com/app1 and succesfully get location of jack@bt.com/app1. 

Pretend to be fred@bt.com/app2 and unsuccesfully get location of jack@bt.com/app1. 

Pretend to be fred@bt.com/app2 and unsuccesfully get location of jack@bt.com/app2. 

Pretend to be fred@bt.com/app2 and unsuccesfully get location of jack@bt.com/app1

It is not possible to get a list of applications registered on any particular day. This story would extract this data from another data source either log files or possibly ldap certificates.

As a developer I want an appropriate entry in the 'from' field of an outbound mail so that I can send mails responsibly and professionally

Revisiting this
From: Rogers,S,Stephen,XSD1 R 
Sent: Wednesday, August 29, 2007 6:51 AM
To: Karsten,PA,Paul,XSL3 R; Didrichsen,G,Gavin,XSD1 R; Gibson,D,David,XSD1 R; Campbell,S,Stephen,XSD1 R
Subject: RE: please remind me

Paul,
 
From here https://collaborate.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/SMS+User+Story+Acceptance it appears that the decisions were:
\u2022\u0009Hardcode "Sent_Using_BT_Web21C_SDK" in the email From header so that client can't 'spoof' an email for a reply. We also tried to word this so that a malicious email wouldn't be 'blamed' on the BT SDK; it was "Sent_Using..."
\u2022\u0009'from' can be anything even an email. This shouldn't present a problem since it will be mapped to the Subject email header.
So from is mapped to the Subject field in the email (this would need to be made clear to user). 
 
Thanks

This item only applies to templates designed to run as containers for the customer. For example, if a customer is expected to upload their application or website into the appliance for a server such as Apache or JBoss to run for them, this would be the mechanism by which they would, ideally, be able to install it. Templates that server a single application such as a wiki would not use this kind of system at the front end.

The implementation would need to be customised for each server type, but the model would run along the lines of User writes an ant script to build and deploy the app. They would then commit it ot a Subversion repo and finally, the ppliance, at start up, would check the appliance out and build it with Ant.

When a new report needs to be scheduled to run periodically, it should start running purely based on a new entry in this config file - no manual editing of the cron jobs on the server should be required.

Amar:

A bug ive found in conferencing while running some manual tests:
 
EndConference currently kills the conference and every participant in it .

However, if for example an announcement is playing to 3 people and I hit end conference nothing happens.

Ideally what we need to do is find all media calls with an active status and kill them.

It would involve searching participant table for participants with status active, with the specified conf id. Then mediaCallBean.terminatemediaCall(mediaCallId).

Also dont forget to refund the chit (although we may already do this in the mediaEventlistener, onCallTerminated() event, I havent checked)

The other question is do we really want to cut people of while announcements are playing....

Jira: PC-362

SDK sets up a Voice Call

Caller phone rings
Caller answers
Callee phone rings
SDK call endCall
Callee phone stops ringing
Caller phone is still connected

i.e. we are not killing the caller call leg. 

This is happening because of the way events are handled when we upgraded the Ubquiity Service Components. We have misedd this scenario when changing the code.

I don't think this is a show stopper as the caller will just hangup (all they hear is silence). What do you think?
























Example:

From\u0009          To\u0009           Count
447852179318\u000918687406822\u0009111






RE: AppReg Security Issue User Story

I can't recall for sure, but I think the better solution was to utilize the serial # and issuer, too. That would guarantee things are unique. Sorry, don't remember too much here, but the serial # _should_ never be reused, unless we totally hose up our CA.
 
As long as Sentry can be configured to look at serial # as well as subject DN, then we should be ok.

-Dustin


















Comes back as service exception when it should be invalid state. Race condition. Ubiquity exception we don't currently handle

How do we test?

There is a wiki page with all shared exceptions






Mike the customer: I then received a "You have successfully unsubscribed..." response. 
Incidentally this message said to reply with "RESUME", however there was no sender address according to my phone, so this didn't work. Sending this unsubscription message with oneway not twoway.












This is necessary in both the numbers for a phone call and the numbers for blocking. 

[Validation will return an error on invalid numbers, -- this is handled by the SDK -- PSD]

canonicalisation will ensure we compare like for like. Without it, the user could block the number 0044123 and the naughty caller could circumvent the block by using +44123. Same with spaces, dashes, etc.

Determin Store
Build Store






CRLs -- We tried to use them, but Sentry doesn\u2019t have a concept of a dynamic CRL where it automatically updates every N minutes/hours/days. Instead, you have to manually update it in Sentry, which sucks. The suggested means by Sentry is to add a CDP (CRL Distribution Point) url to the certificate which can (always is?) used for revocation checking. That is, we could add a URL such as "https://sdk.bt.com/ca/crl" to each certificate and when Sentry recieves a cert, it will go to that location to check the CRL. And, of course, we'd constantly publish the latest CRL to that url. :)

-Dustin






Overtaken by different story CA Front End






See Dustin's email re: 4 options. Paul likes option 4 for the sandbox. Option 3 sounds good for production.

Figure out how we do this.






Option 3 in dustin's email

Verisign outside of our control

Our work isnt' much, but lots of logistics and legal etc






Per Tim Reid e-mail:

OutboundCallFlow:startCallFlow - 20 hits per day.
Callflow will configure our service to kill the call after 2 minutes.






Move from app name as key to owner_email + app_name






1. I think the WSExceptionAspect class can be updated so that instances of IllegalArgumentException are logged as info, rather than error.






Time Stevens and Piotr have now separately raised concerns over the overwrite behaviour in the putFile() operation, of the CallProvisioning service.

Currently, if you specify a file that doesn't exist, and set overwrite=true, then an exception raised stating the resource doesn't exist.

I personally like this behaviour to start with, as I thought it would avoid typos/errors (e.g. specifying the wrong file to overwrite).

The new behaviour would simply create the file, giving full trust to the calling app.1 












I want a way to change which cert I am using for my development project

- Demonstrate lifecycle management (creation / modification / deletion)
- Demonstrate publication accountability by illustrating the change verification step in the publication process
- Illustrate automated notification mechanism when ever a change to an entry occurs

-----------------
ggg)\u0009High quality and accurate data
hhh)\u0009Improved Right First Time






Provide a mechanism to allow people to reset their password.

- Password is stored in ejabberd.

- Fairly simple call. This is just an API call, using MAC.












Change the call to SMS and send proper SAML with the application id set.
NOTE :- The replyToUri field is currently not used in SMS for any functionality and this will remain the case in iteration 1.

A valid call from Location would look like :-
sendMessage(URI[recipients tel no's], null, null, "MessageText") - along with valid saml and saml application id set.
Any strings entered in place of null above will simply be ignored.

Currently the getReceivedMessages method is in the messaging.wsdl but this is not exposed externally by the sdk yet.
We would now like the SDK's to expose this method now if possible as the functionality in the capability is now implemented behind it to secure it for external use.

This means that Location again will have to use proper SAML with the application id set in this call also as we will use it for validation.
Also Location should call with their keyword parameter instead of the current registrationid eg. ( getReceivedMessages("LOC"); )

This means that Location will have to create SAML and have a special appdId. Need to speak to Adrian about this.












See email from Uros "FW: Quarantine Web-Service endpoint"

Acceptance:
All tests still work
No need for WSDL editing before Sentry loading






setting roster availability resets group and directed availability

setting group availability resets directed availability

Amend the tests so that each test uses a different deviceId

i.e.

endpoint/Session/ThirdPartyCall/2007/02

instead of

endpoint/SessionThirdPartyCall/2007/02

I believe it was regarding the message sender rather than the exception type. When you specify the sender as a telephone number, you receive an ArgumentException with a message \u201cinvalid from entered:01234xxxxxxx\u201d. It was really about passing a better message. Maybe something more descriptive without specifically saying \u201cNo spoofing\u201d, maybe \u201cInvalid sender specified. The sender cannot be a telephone number\u201d?






People can't tell the difference between 0 and O, so start with loc 1 y

Trev's comment:
We could translate the letter "O" (upper and lower case) to be the same as zero.
In the case of '1' then we might with to do the same for letter 'L' (upper and lower case) - as this could similarly be confused.

Acceptance tests:-

- Prove that x reg, x canc and x y/n all work with 0, o, O, l, L and 1












This is what we should be using for best interop, per MS.

If I log in, close my browser, open another one later and browse to any private page (e.g. my calls) I can see that page because my session is still live. That's fine. 

However, if I've browse to mojo.bt.com, I am allowed to log in even though I am already logged in. I should be redirected to my Home.

Error tables are being create for chit data because last_modified columns are null. The stored procedures need updating to handle this situation to use the created_on column instead.












ChitQueuer and Chit






Fitnesse client that includes an automated test that adds 2 chits to an app via our web service, checks the app's chit level via our webservcie, sends a real event to chit, and checks the balance again to see that it made it thru to chit

hat removes your dependency on us to manually verify whether chits were deducted etc...i think for the log files and making sure we don't alarm like crazy this time, that's just going to have to be a manual inspection by us

Do we need a dummy app set up? actually, chit doesn't do any validation that it's a real app id (because it assumes that it got through sentry so it's valid)... so as long as you give it enough chits that it doesn't send warning emails or tries to disable (in which case it goes to app reg) then you should be ok

_____________________________________________ 
From: \u0009Watson,T,Tim,XSL3 R 
Sent:\u000930 July 2007 13:02
To:\u0009Didrichsen,G,Gavin,XSD1 R
Cc:\u0009Gibson,D,David,XSD1 R; Campbell,S,Stephen,XSD1 R; Rogers,S,Stephen,XSD1 R
Subject:\u0009RE: Inbound Messaging Provisioning issue.

Hi Gavin,

Sure thing; I think this has to do with the process of inserting data into the smskeysforclient table in the database. The id column for this table is set up to use a value from a database sequence as it\u2019s default value. No primary key is set on this column and records have clearly been inserted by hand (because the max(id) on this column is out of synch with the sequence), so it\u2019s difficult to script provisioning because if we rely on the sequence for the next value and somebody has specified a value explicitly while adding a row, the insert statement won\u2019t fail (because there\u2019s no constraint to stop duplicate keys being inserted). 

I think that\u2019s the only real issue we found. Let me know if you need any other info.

Cheers, 

Tim Watson
Technologist
BT Web21C SDK
Email:\u0009tim.watson@bt.com
Cell:\u0009+44 7918 711 612

Hi Terry, 

Just taking a brief look, you\u2019ll need the Confluence Developer Kit - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Plugin+Development+Kit which uses Java and you can create something that calls the services using the Java SDK.  It looks like it should be possible, I suppose you\u2019d just have to consider where it\u2019d be placed and who would pay for the messages (once we get into production and figure out our billing model).

Conf and 3pc currently map the internal Terminating call state to Connected / Active. Consider mapping to Terminated to provide more reliable call teardown detection. (May be of relevance for Engagements guys)






Consider moving GetDeliveryInformation off the component and onto the SmsMessage object.

This is non-trivial as the SmsMessage object needs to work with the both SmsInbound and SmsOneWay services - it cannot call a specific logic layer object directly.

Consider anon. delegate.

See delegate example:
http://engineering.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/Simple+Delegate+example






Rather than having the endpoints embedded in the code, consider adding them to an online xml file (like the faultcodes list).

[Discussed - Not worthwhile, service endpoints should not change other than versioning. To determine dynamically does not derive any great benefit]

lesley.streatfield1@btinternet.com.

We are looking for styling for external registry, internal publishing, wsdl generation tool(?)






Make all the WSDLs use consistent namespaces, prefixes and layout and wherever possible use the same names for the same concept. 






WLA has task list groups according to operation (because loginResponse needs to sign saml). Instead, we should have 2 task lists that are part of 1 group, and have that group associated w/ the whole service. One checks if there's saml, and if so, sign it, and the 2nd adds the ws-security header and signs the body/timestamp etc

Also we need to figure out how to consolidate the login response task lists (currently 1 for each version) down into this response task list

Ross/Alkesh and John,

Here is the details of the portal changes for messaging for the upcoming release on 29th Oct:
\u2022\u0009Resume keyword needs mentioned here: http://web21c.bt.com/services/inbound_sms with a new bullet point (Resume - this enables a user to resubscribe to an application they have unsubscribed to by replying with "resume" as the first word in the SMS. DONE
\u2022\u0009Eventing here: http://web21c.bt.com/services/messaging - should be called "Status Events" and should mention the HOW-TO: http://web21c.bt.com/howtos/setting_up_a_messaging_event_listener_java_example DONE
\u2022\u0009There should also be another bullet point here: http://web21c.bt.com/services/inbound_sms called "Inbound Messages Events - this allows an application to set up an inbound message event listener (see HOW-TO) and send us details of a URL (mailto:sdkportal@bt.com with title "Inbound Events URL") from which we will post all inbound messages to them thus saving the application the need to poll for getReceivedMessages. This is a fire and forget HTTP post so if the application needs to be absolutely sure of picking up all messages then it should also poll once a day to check". This will need to reference the new HOW-TO (below).DONE
\u2022\u0009So we need another How-to "Setting up an Inbound SMS Event Listener - Java example" like this https://collaborate.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/How+to+set+up+an+Inbound+Eventing+Listener
\u2022\u0009The existing HOW-TO http://web21c.bt.com/howtos/setting_up_a_messaging_event_listener_java_example ought to be called "Setting up a Messaging Statuses Event Listener - Java example"DONE
\u2022\u0009http://web21c.bt.com/services/messaging - remove reference to "or short code" as inbound doesn't offer this
\u2022\u0009http://web21c.bt.com/services/inbound_sms - states "with USA, Premium Rate and Short Code numbers available in the near future". John - do you agree with this?DONE

Also noticed, this page (http://web21c.bt.com/pricing) needs to say that the rental period choices for inbound SMS are 3 months, 6 months and 1 year only.DONE

At least two of our CC's (Session and Presence) do not require a user saml or WLA login.

Therefore, the tasks that use it fail and cause issues.

I renamed "WLA-Login Request Task List" to "CommonCapabilityRequest-NoUserSaml" which does everything BUT examine the user saml (even if it exists).

We MAY need to create a fitnesse test that tests this new task list and get it tested on Radon194.

Create a corrected appliation id exposure that prevents users from spoofing their sender.

Provide a text description of app or number. Number is spoofing. We can prevent putting their numbers. But could be sending a text on behalf of someone else:
1. Text
2. Number (bad - ivan thinks its good - tim thinks evil outweighs the good)
3. Can say I am app sending on behalf of this number

How does reply to work then? Pass an app id? We do this for location - we can change numbers for location and they don't actually know.

Existing acceptance tests work

This is kinda the opposite of "Deduct chits from appropriate buckets".

Issue:
How does the service know what bucket to credit back? Jack came up with a very possible scenario (perhaps we ignore it for now?) \u2013

If I make a TPC which fails due to \u201conCallConnectFailed\u201d, how will Session know which bucket to credit back to? We can see a situation where we COULD figure out how to force a call to fail and thus effectively move all promo chits into the \u201cdefault/purchased\u201d bucket.

POTENTIAL SOLUTION: Just find the "last" active promo since that is the bucket that probably was used to use chits from in the first place.

Paul,

 

I got your text message yesterday from the trace listener. You are so cool (but you know that!)

 

As you know, we just completed our planning session for our next release (known internally as the Black Death release \u2013 we name our releases after plagues. Done Hanta and Ebola already. After all, why not? We want the SDK to be viral!)

 

It turns out that one of the streams in the next release is the Web21C Engagements stream. I lead it, and Robbie is Scrum Master; you have to feel sympathy for him trying to manage me, you\u2019ve been there! Josh and Tim Stokes (T3) are also in this team. Your request falls exactly into that stream, which is great.

 

We\u2019re not going to be production ready until sometime in April. At which point we should have some kind of commercial model, but for you app it will be an internal transfer, and we have all that in another stream (SDK Promote to Production)

 

So if this is mission critical, I\u2019d say that you need to wait till then. OTOH, if you expect to be sending only a small number of texts (up to 20 a day now, the limit went up), then I\u2019m not 100% closed to you doing that, on the understanding that when it hits production you are ready for a migration strategy (different cert, possibly different endpoint, money maybe changes hands somehow). After all, you could use our beta service right now without telling us (though we do monitor\u2026)

 

I\u2019d like to understand a little about more about your app, which LOB it supports, what product, volumetrics &c.

 

Robbie, make sure we have listed this somewhere.

 

We\u2019ll have a chat about getting this into Codeplex at some point too, and getting M$FT blogs written, as that really interests me!

 

Tim

 

From: Hillman,P,Paul,XGG7A C 
Sent: 12 January 2007 11:44
To: Clutton,R,Robbie,XSE6 R; Stevens,TJ,Tim,XSL3 R
Cc: Leghari,N,Nauman,XBB1 R
Subject: EntLib 2.0 SMS Trace Listener code complete 

 

Guys,

 

I\u2019ve finished the code for the EntLib 2.0 SMS Trace Listener but need to write up a few words around it. I\u2019ve added to the sample SMS Message form so that it logs each time you click a button \u2013 figured that is the easiest way for people to understand it.

 

I would like to implement this in the ASP.NET 2.0 application we support so it sends a text when the daily download is complete. Is the SDK ready for this yet \u2013 do I need to register a \u201cspecial\u201d application that does not have the limits for texts/day? Will I need to pay?

 

 

Paul

Guys,

Hi, Dave G has been off since the planning so I just wanted to check if he made you aware of the stuff needed on the portal regarding the new messaging send method sendMessageWithEventing(). For punters to use it they need to set themselves up with a listener as described here https://collaborate.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/How+to+set+up+an+Eventing+Listener. So the portal should probably tell them something about this. It does mention the method but not how to set up a listener, as far as I can see - are you aware of all this already?

Thanks






We don't currently have an API that allows you to check the ability of a location service to track a particular device. If we get an exception from Vodafone, then we look to see if we have stored location values for the device and, if so, we return these as the last known location with a timestamp of when they were captured.

Look at the type of exception we get from Vodafone and return a suitable response to the SDK user. 

If a device cannot be located because there's no locator configured, then any op in the interface should fail fast.

at the moment if we try to locate, say, an orange number, we allow sending of permission sms and registration, but then not being any locator the getLocation fails.

this should not happen.

Check emails sent have FQDN :

"New post in General 
Just a heads up that I had problems registering for the site/SDK. The bt mail server sending out the passwords doesn't send a FQDN in the HELO statement and was therefore rejected as spam.

I thought I'd point out as many mailservers are configured to reject mail where a FQDN isn't given in the HELO statement. "

Either needs an MX record saying we're the server for web21c.bt.com, or go via the BT relay (THRS).

When an exception occurs the fault codes document is downloaded and saved on to the file system. In IIS there may be permission exceptions thrown. We need to handle these and cache the documents runtime.

- Robbie

Suggestion: Store the fault codes list in memory, don't save to disk. See "YourMum" post on the forum.

It was brought up that one of the CallFlow methods returns an \u201cOK\u201d string at the manager level. In the other services we hide these \u201cOK\u201d strings at the manager level. So, would you be able to change this to maintain consistency?

This is still deducting chits at the SQL level where setChits (update) does it at the business level. Change deduct chits to also do this at the business level.






User experience:  Try to add an attribute with > 255 chars and you get:
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"
  xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <soap:Body>
    <soap:Fault>
      <faultcode xmlns:sdkfault="http://sdk.bt.com/2006/07/Fault">sdkfault:ServiceException</faultcode>
      <faultstring>Unable to fulfill request do to an internal error.</faultstring>
      <faultactor>WhiteLabelAuthentication</faultactor>
    </soap:Fault>
  </soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

Figure out why @annotation(javax.jws.WebMethod) doesn't work






1. Several tasks do not implement executionError() correctly. 

2. As an example, the RecordActionHandler uses the now overloaded executeNextAction() method on the CallFlowControl interface to pass an appropriate error message that will be stored in the FlowExecution.

3. The work here is to check the error flows for all tasks and check whether they need updating to implement the behaviour used in the RecordActionHandler.






1. Several tasks do not implement executionError() correctly. 

2. As an example, the RecordActionHandler uses the now overloaded executeNextAction() method on the CallFlowControl interface to pass an appropriate error message that will be stored in the FlowExecution.

3. The work here is to check the error flows for all tasks and check whether they need updating to implement the behaviour used in the RecordActionHandler.

Clearing mdc values when finished with thread






The guard timers on the ACME are not clearing calls as they should when the media session ends.

Acceptance:
All possible exceptions fixed or reason given












The DeploymentConfiguration class is currently causing a lot of trouble, because it tries to 'magically' resolve the location of the config.yaml file based on either (a) and environment variable called 'STARTUP_PATH' or (b) the builtin $PROGRAM_NAME value or (c) one of the entries in the application's $LOAD_PATH array. 

This is convoluted and really hard to follow/understand, is making refactoring difficult and hides potential problems instead of revealing it's usage clearly. 

I propose that we force the class to take a reference to the config.yaml file in it's constructor, making it the responsibility of the consumer to figure out where the *actual* deployment configuration lives on disk. 

This is a breaking API change.


















Similar to BBV issues






SmsMessageDataMapper.clearReceivedMessages(..) is causing "org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: IN types integer and character varying cannot be matched" exception occuring on CTE. Exception in sms.log is below:

####################################################################
org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: PreparedStatementCallback; bad SQL grammar [update SmsMessage set isRead = 'Y', readTime = current_timestamp where id in (select SmsMessage.id from SmsMessage, SmsKeysForClient where SmsMessage.destinationUri = SmsKeysForClient.destinationUri and (SmsMessage.key = SmsKeysForClient.key or SmsKeysForClient.key is null) and SmsKeysForClient.applicationIdentifier = ? and SmsMessage.id in (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?))]; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: IN types integer and character varying cannot be matched

Caused by: 

org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: IN types integer and character varying cannot be matched
##################################################################

CTE's Postgres (I think its a newer version than the one on Production, 197, CI, etc) seems to have tightened down on Type checking. The culprit method is populating a mixed-type object array of sql parameters, both String-type and Integer-type. This is causing the barf. 

Basically, the fix is to change a line of code in above method

FROM
params[i + 1] = Integer.parseInt(messageIds[i]);

TO
params[i + 1] = messageIds[i];

As the messaging capability we want to be able to fix the portal information without depending on teh portal team






1. In Call Flow, we could have a potential problem where there is a recursive call to a 'dialog' tag. e.g.

<call id="start" target="sip:XXXXXXXXX" next="prompt"/>
\u0009
<prompt id="prompt" audio="file://prompt.wav">
 <input pattern="1" next="connect" />
 <input pattern="2" next="recursivelyreconnect" />
</prompt> 

<announcement audio="reconnect.wav" id="recursivelyreconnect" next="connect"/>
 \u0009
<dialog id="connect" target="sip:XXXXXXXXX" next="prompt"/>

2. This could probably be fixed in the VoiceFlowValidatorImpl class?






1. We have a scenario where an inbound script can be removed, but there is an existing mapping still there.
2. The result is that the inbound mapping can't be removed and re-added as there is not a corresponding FileRecord.
3. The current circumvention is to re-add the FileRecord mapping then perform the remove/add of the inbound script.






as exposed by BT_ServiceMaker






get model to wsdl tool and cruisecontrol running again






https://collaborate.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/Project+Setup+and+Pre-Deployment+Steps






- Saving cert with empty password fails later when using cert in user application.

- Cannot cancel out of the save dialog when saving cert.






Dustin and Andy from Denver raised an issue where a malicious developer could create a keypair w/ a subject DN that is the exact same AppName/GUID as someone else, and AppReg will go ahead and sign the public key creating a cert w/ the same SubjectDN. The issue is that Sentry can only distinguish certs by this subject DN, when it SHOULD be using the issuer/serial number (if it did, this woudln't be an issue). Also, if Sentry is configured for SiteMinder, then SiteMinder can distinguish on issuer/serial number. In the meantime, suggest we don't sign a cert if the subjectDN already exists for some other app.

Talk to Denver if you have questions

Acceptance:
Fitnesse test to show duplicate can't be entered






TPC records often have missing txn ids, and these records were previously excluded from staging. This is a mistake as we loose far to much data by doing so. 

Instead, we are allowing for NULL transaction id in staging (and session_cost_fact). The stored procedures should really coalesce these values to 'unknown' instead.












1. The destinationUri parameter for the inbound getCallFlowInformations() works with a uri in the format:-

tel:00442070431798

rather than:-

tel:442070431798

e.g. it is using the localised format, rather than the standard format.

This is a little confusing for the users.

2. Update the tel: uri that we store in the FlowExecution table.

Why do I have two ways to hang up? Why do I have to know or care? Just stop the damn call.

Sip level issue. Cancel call and hang up. Race condition. Should not be doing that. SDK call has start and stop just. Need to change API and tests. Could have additional method on WSDL. Integration testing. Need Downey to bless your WSDL. 
Also versioning comes in - different namespace. Can't just release a new API. Have to support old interface for a while as well.

A good starting point is

http://redsideservices.nat.bt.com/PublishingExternalWebService/index.php

Please remember that the information you put about your service will be viewed externally.

Ross






A good starting point is

http://redsideservices.nat.bt.com/PublishingExternalWebService/index.php

And in particular

http://redsideservices.nat.bt.com/PublishingExternalWebService/model.php

Please remember that the information you put about your service will be viewed externally.

Ross






It really shouldn't be a WSDL but rather a different style of parameter (user:username@application).

Folks,
Just wanted to make you aware of the details regarding the new functionality exposed by messaging.
I think you may have a user story this iteration to consume Internal Messaging. This allows users of an application to send messages to each other.
Attached is the wsdl. There are two operations exposed.

1) sendMessage(recipientUsers, message) - where recipientUsers is of the URI scheme of "user:user1@dicksapp" - this corresponds to the username of the user stored in WLA.
So in order to use internal messaging the applications must use WLA and be signed in etc. The SDK's could simply prepend the scheme of the URI -"user:" to the username of the recipients the person wishes to send to.

2) getReceivedMessages() - This takes no parameters and we simply responds with any internal messages stored for that user. (We pick the username up from the saml)

To get the feel for its use you can look at our FitNesse tests found at : -http://132.146.63.15:9090/SmsService.SmsTests.InternalMessaging

We have deployed the functionality on 197 - endpoint being http://132.146.185.197:8080/endpoint/SMSInternalMessaging/2007/01

Hopefully this is simple enough for you guys. I am on leave until Thursday so I can answer any questions then.


<see InternalMessaging.wsdl>
 
Thanks,
David Gibson,

From: Karsten,PA,Paul,DLN R 
Sent: Wednesday, October 10, 2007 7:26 AM

Subject: RE: Need a decision on how to proceed w/ the lack of email?

Tentative approval of 2\u2026what changes Dustin?

From: Ochsner,AM,Andrew,DLN R 
Sent: Wednesday, October 10, 2007 7:23 AM
To: Karsten,PA,Paul,DLN R
Subject: Need a decision on how to proceed w/ the lack of email?

We can chat about it but here are your options:
 
1)\u0009Update AppReg WSDL version to 2007/09 and expose getApplication(String id).  Includes fitnesse tests and deployment hell.  AND either forcing our clients (Portal is the only one?) to upgrade to the version or support 2 versions.  
2)\u0009Update AppReg version 2007/07 exposing getApplication(String id).  Again fitnesse tests and deployment hell.  But no worry about forcing our clients to upgrade or support 2 versions.  
3)\u0009Make Session and Messaging store AppName and AppEmail in addition to the AppId and send those along in the events as well.

I prefer 2) and I think it\u2019s reasonable because we aren\u2019t changing any existing operations, and the entity we want to return is already defined in the model.  So it\u2019s just 1 new operation, no new types, no changes to existing operations/types.  I hate the idea of managing a release for yet another capability\u2026however, dustin said he\u2019d be glad to if I could get you to agree to some changes.  Even if he doesn\u2019t do it, it might not be too bad for us to manage since Chit only exists in Production and not Sandbox.  

Anyways, I\u2019m not fond of the idea that there\u2019s more work we\u2019d have to do, but we need to do something\u2026

Andy O

https://collaborate.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/Form+for+Inbound+SMS+Provision+Request

Based on: 
"As a product owner I want a form for SMS inbound number requests so that I can be confident that all requests for such service have a robust route into provisioning process

From John Mac"

A form to allow a user to request an inbound SMS number.

The form should capture:
- shared or dedicated number?
- application name
- requested keyword
- uk only or worldwide coverage
- how many months to purchase - 3, 6, 9, 12.

The details are stored in the portal as an order, which is associated to a user.
The order will have status: open, closed.

Once the order is created, the details are emailed to a group email account.






There should be a page on the portal
listing all inbound sms provisioning orders,
with their status and captured details.

Once the order has been manually provisioned, 
there should be a page on the portal to 
allow the order to be closed.

The following details should be captured:
- the inbound sms number
- the keyword
- expiry date
- credits deducted






1. Currently validation of inbound scripts is performed at run time, which is a little late in the processing as the user is never aware of validation issues, except by evaluating any execution errors recorded in the Flow Execution trace.

2. It would be better to perform the validation during the provisioning putFile() operation.

3. The engine ValidatorImpl class could be modified to perform this (e.g. suppress global variable evaluation, construct a engine context etc.)

The incorrect fault type is returned when the caller or callee is not set.

A new generic stored called fn_migrate_staging has been created to build sql to move data from one or more source Raw tables to a staging table. It takes an array of raw table names and the order is Important as it determines the order of the join statement, and it takes the destination staging table name. (There is a third parameter that controls whether or not the staging table is truncated (i.e migrating cost raw data needs a finer control over the staging table).) These two parameters (source table names and destination table names) are used to lookup various properties for the sql. 

1. table_mappings table - controls the expression in the select list for a particular column. It contains one row for each staging table column:

source_table_name, source_column_name, destination_table_name, destination_column_name, exp

The final column is null if the default sql expression should be used (see fn_convert_to_type()). If not null the sql in this column is used directly in the dynamically executed sql.

2. table_joins table - controls the way multiple tables are joined. Contains one row for each join expression needed where multiple raw tables are migrated into a staging table. It's a little clunky in that the join_exp is used directly in the sql.

source_table_name, destination_table_name, join_exp

3. global_required_columns, global_required_columns_sql and key_prefixes tables - control the where clause is built up.

"global_required_columns" (row_id, table_name, column_name, lookup_sql)

If lookup_sql is false then a default where expression for the where clause is generated for the given table_name and column_name.
If lookup_sql is true then it looks up the where expression from "global_required_columns_sql":

"global_required_columns_sql" (table_name, column_name, exclusive_clause, inclusive_clause)

global_required_columns_sql contains one row for each raw table column that determines if, when moving data from raw to staging, a row is valid or not. 
The exclusive_clause is used when inserting data into the staging table. Usually exp1 and exp2.
The inclusive_clause is used hwne inserting data into the error table. Usually exp1 or exp2.

key_prefixes - a kind of sql hack :-(
the format of global_required_columns does not support the situation where the same raw table is used in 2 or more migrations to a staging table e.g. SessionRaw->SessionStaging and SessionRaw->SessionCostRaw.
This table lists prefixes used in the table_name column in global_required_columns and global_required_columns_sql tables to support multiple mappings.

fn_migrate_staging is not fancy and could probably be cooler - but it works.... for now. :-)

10 ports can't be exceeded. Just setting it statically once. Should set initially to 3 and update dynamically. Two API calls: allocate and free.

Outstanding Jira http://engineering.intra.bt.com/jira/browse/PC-371 from Erich:

1. Save the number of messages in my queue before sending a new message.
(look at the pseudo code below)

recMsgsBeforeSending = smsInb.GetReceivedMessages(InboundKeyword);

2. Value for this variable: recMsgsBeforeSending = 85

3. Now I try sending a new message:

msgId = smsInb.SendMessage(InboundKeyword + " " + InboundTextMessage, InboundPhonesNumber);

4. I get the number of messages in the queue:
recMsgsAfterSending = smsInb.GetReceivedMessages(InboundKeyword);

5. The value for recMsgsAfterSending is 85, so it looks to be that the message was not sent.

It doesn't happen all the time. It looks to be something random.

Nigel: "Make sure you raise this with him though as it needs to work if we\u2019re to be sell this service"

From: Lionis,I,Yannis,DDF R 
Sent: 19 October 2007 16:52
To: Rapajic,U,Uros,DLN R; Karsten,PA,Paul,DLN R
Subject: RE: Calls to IVR

 

Good question. If it\u2019s the phone, then it\u2019s all phones because I\u2019ve done it on more than one mobiles (not all of them impressively new either). But if I had to guess, that\u2019s the mobile interpreting \u201cp\u201d as \u201cwait for the prompt\u201d, in which case the question is if our PSTN breakout can do that. 

 

From: Rapajic,U,Uros,DLN R 
Sent: 19 October 2007 16:22
To: Lionis,I,Yannis,DDF R; Karsten,PA,Paul,DLN R
Subject: RE: Calls to IVR

 

Is that a feature of the phone or the service provider?

 

If it\u2019s the latter, happy to add to the backlog.

 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From: Lionis,I,Yannis,DDF R 
Sent: 19 October 2007 16:19
To: Karsten,PA,Paul,DLN R; Rapajic,U,Uros,DLN R
Subject: RE: Calls to IVR

 

I don\u2019t know if CallFlow does this, but that aside, this is an interesting request. From my mobile, I can call the following number ( this is my BT MeetMe):

 

08708506521p66695259#

 

This dials the first number, waits for the prompt and dials the next series of digits (along with hash \u2013 or \u201cpound symbol\u201d if you\u2019re American :-). It\u2019s really convenient and I think this is the kind of thing he wants to do. My theory is that the only reason you can\u2019t do that now is because the Session regex rejects the letter \u201cp\u201d (and probably the \u201c#\u201d as well). Should we add a story to allow those two characters? Even if CallFlow does this in some way, it would still be a useful feature for ThirdPartyCall users in the meantime.

 

Yannis

Set CLI to calling party in 3rd party call.

e.g. We would like to set the CLI in third pary calls to the originator of the call. Is this allowed?

See Jira http://engineering.intra.bt.com/jira/browse/PC-359

At the Accelerator we saw that when there was two 'BT Server' certs (trusted people) and two 'BT CA' (trusted root) certs were installed, this resulted in the SOAP body not being signed. WSE did not throw an error, but Sentry puked saying there wasn't a signed element. When we deleted both certs and reinstalled, making sure there was only one, this then resulted in signing the SOAP body and making phones ring.

[Investigated -  could not reproduce issue without more detail]

Simian (Similarity Analyser) identifies duplication in Java, C#, C, C++, COBOL, Ruby, JSP, ASP, HTML, XML, Visual Basic source code and even plain text files. In fact, simian can be used on any human readable files such as ini files, deployment descriptors, you name it. 

Reviewed here:

http://communities.nat.bt.com/display/DOTNET/Simian+-+Tool+Review






The SDK Team are getting memory issues with JBoss. It could be to do with a version issue or down to the fact the appliance does not have any swap space. However, neither does any other appliance. I'll need to do some investigation to see how it is aded and if it makes a difference.

At first glance, it appears WIX would resolve many of the issues we curently face with the installer:

Wix is an XML based compiler and linker to generate MSIs.  Supports Merge modules, custom actions etc..

Good Guide here:
http://www.tramontana.co.hu/wix/
and here:
http://wix.sourceforge.net/manual-wix2/authoring.htm

Trailing slash issue with some OpenID providers. See mail below from Paul:

_____________________________________________
On 18 Oct 2007, at 07:03, Stefan Tilkov wrote:

>>> No, doesn't work (both with and without the /)
>>
>> double rats! I'm guessing you're using phpMyID as the provider?
>
> Yes, phpMyID 0.3.
>

Installing apps to IIS has ended up being rather hard.

- Moving Certificates onto a server machine from a local machine is non-trivial.

- On the server we need to change the store from CurrentUser to LocalMachine. Currently this involves hand-editing the config files.

Needs script or tool to set up this process.

The database design does not support hard constraints on the Profile record being there.
For example, the PolicyEntity is defines thus...
..CONSTRAINT fk_deviceid FOREIGN KEY (deviceid)
 REFERENCES profileentity (deviceid) MATCH SIMPLE
 ON UPDATE NO ACTION ON DELETE NO ACTION, This says that on delete etc take no action. It could be changed to say on delete cascade - then it would remove the childrem

We should implement a policy of deleting all dependants when a Policy is UPDATEd or DELETEd.






- see if we can make this faster

_____________________________________________ 
From: \u0009Harris,PM,Pete,XSD1 R 
Sent:\u000923 May 2007 10:03
To:\u0009Karsten,PA,Paul,XSL3 R
Subject:\u0009RE: Use of Location 1 (2006/07) in Sandbox

Paul

I like to get a feel for risk associated with anything that is changed. 

We have created ourselves a legacy problem by retaining separate code bases for Location 1 (ie 2006/07) and Location 2 (ie 2007/01). 

Location 1 is a dusty relic in SVN \u2026 we'll fetch it out and back-fill tests and new behaviour but the primary focus will remain on Location 2.

However, we have few, if any, tests for Location 1 and Location 2 working together on the same database. It would make me happier to know I was covering the known Location 1 usage when we made a new delivery.

A a night's sleep on the matter \u2026

Given the need for maintenance of Location 1 and 2 for the duration of this cycle, I feel we must address the consolidation of the Location implementation. Otherwise, we shall carry the heavy burden of parallel development and deployment.

It occurred to me that we could overcome the duplicated code if we could turn Location 1 into a wrapper for the Location 2 implementation. Other than unsetGeoLocation() being removed from the WSDL, there is a 1:1 mapping of the methods. It would need a bit of brainstorming to agree on the best way of implementing the XML transformations, both request and response. 

Another option would be to consider putting the 2006/07 WSDLs into the trunk (beware package namespace issues).

The advantage as I see it would be that we could ignore pollution at the database level due to the functional differences between the 2 implementations.

It would also mean that Location 1 would keep up with functional improvements, such as the Code of Conduct and the benefits of the different Location data supllier (eg MxTelecom). Any idea if the dual deployment might spoil any attempt to sanitise our logging?

I suppose there will be issues as well but these will shake out when it's discussed. I just don't think we can carry on as we are with Location 1 \u2026 the usage was just to get an idea of the scale of the problem.

Best regards,

Pete

_____________________________________________

Paul

Can you confirm that you're happy with this line of attack?

Thanks,

Pete

From: \u0009Karsten,PA,Paul,XSL3 R

Yes.

http://collaborate.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/Technical+Analysis






Test we can talk to the Location service






Currently, 3 classes exist in the location logic layer:

- Device
- DevicePolicy
- PartyPolicy

Device and DevicePolicy are somewhat confusing, as they both represent a single device, with attribute/s about that device.  Device contains a GeoLocation and DevicePolicy contains a collection of PartyPolicy objects.  After discussion, it seemed logical to merge Device and DevicePolicy into a single class, so that users could access different pieces of information about a device in a consistent manner.

This will require an extensive refactor of the location logic layer, as well as the web and win components, and 


Renaming PartyPolicy (a relationship between a tracker and device, with the relationship indicated by the PartyRule enum) to TrackerPolicy was suggested, as a Party is always referred to as a tracker in the parameters.






Hi Trevor \u2013 i\u2019m referring to your 1.0.2 services as exposed on radon197, not the back end service (i.e. port 8080 service).  Your public exposure for 1.0.2 services is on https://xia.bt.com/endpoint/LocationProfile/2006/07 so the internal radon197 exposure should mirror this format.

It\u2019s not a big issue as 1.0.2 will be deprecated eventually, merely for consistency throughout the services.

Regards, Nigel

Cron jobs to first backup all new data to MIS database, then delete old data from working tables.

From a testing point of view, I'm wondering whether the simplest thing that could possibly work would be to do this programatically from the app. Here's the thinking behind this:-

1) We can be more tenacious and effective in our testing. e.g. we can use mocks to inject exception conditions, we can put the db in a known state before a test and assert it using dbunit (this works across different databases). This is especially useful if we need to test rollback scenarios.

2) It is easy to add transaction support with Spring (all done using the app context). So if an insert fails on the archive db, the transaction block is rolled back automatically.

3) It is easy to add timer jobs using Spring, via the app context.

4) We can also keep an accurate picture of exactly what's happening with the processes by writing to the log with existing log processes.

Starting from sentry, into jboss, out of jboss, out of sentry.

Paul got scared that we dont' return transaction id from jboss.  However, since sentry has it's own "context id" we could find the transaction id, based on that get the "context id" and then find the respose based on that "context id"

Andy O






Business methods against the database should be atomic - what this means is that "deduct chits" should either update both tables, or neither table...this does NOT mean that if emails or appreg fails that we should roll back.  Same w/ add chits and the overrides (any others?)

web service operations should be atomic - need to research this a bit and decide whether failure of external things woudl cause this to fail...






I don't think i want global (XA) transactions (sorry that's my developer hat on)

Probably assumes we have database transactions working

This is a bit more complicated, but here's a few scenarios:

if the database is not available, do we just put the message back on the queue and retry (hot potato) until it comes back?).  Do we just log and reprocess later?

If we update the database, but something else fails (appreg, email?) do we take the message off the queue and log it for reprocessing (bad) or just take it off the queue and be done?

If the biz logic works, but there's a JMSError (maybe we weren't able to take the message off the queue, or the queue went down after we updated the database but before  we returned, what happens then?  How do we handle that?  

Are there scenarios (or is the one above sufficient) where we have to support duplicate messages (either we updated the database but weren't able to take it off the queue, or we updated the database but logged the message for reprocessing)?












participantid/messageid/confid/callid/sentrytxid

In order to avoid issues w/ Task List name conflicts






As a developer on the SDK project I want the branched code for release to be merged with the trunk so that we're working against the latest services.






The DevicePolicy object represents a single device with its collection of party policies. The name "device policy" indicates that it is a single policy, not a collection, so it is confusing and unintuitive. The Device object also represents a single device, with its location.

The Device object and DevicePolicy object should be merged into a single object, representing a device.

Review associated methods and there overloads.

See the Contact object in Contacts for an example.






- Merge CA and AppReg CREATEAPP() operations
- Create StubImpl
- Unit tests












XML file that defines what is contained within that template.  Defines the versions and details of all the components contained in the MESH






When sending an SMS message, the message is set to appear to come from the user's user name. If the user name is not suitable for the subject, it mis-presents it.

A better option would be to set the sender based on the gadget. Using the gadget name would have similar issues to those with username. Better still would be a field like the default tel no field.






Provide a timestamp with all messages to indicate when they were sent (i.e. recieved by the server from the sender - not when they were sent to the sendee)

- Not too complex.

- Add custom property






As a developer I want to be able to submit a message for postal delivery so that I can exploit further channels


















Process messaging data












Work with messaging team with their upgrade.






Dustines email (24/09/07) 
Quarantine had a reboot last Thursday evening. Noticed that there was not a startup script in /etc/init.d/ for messaging. We were going to create /etc/init.d/jboss_init_messaging.sh, but noticed that it appears the bindings being used by messaging may be conflicting with other servers.

We noticed this when we were watching for the messaging RMI port to start up when the messaging service started, but didn't see one with the regular expression of "1.99".

Sooo, what this means is that there is currently no working startup script on Quarantine, so if it is bounced, it will not come back up. Also, I fear that if messaging is ever started before another service, then it may grab that service's rmi port and then the startup/shutdown scripts will have unpredictable results.

Can you please put a backlog item in scrumworks to get this fixed for next release?




































Migrate the source tree from StarTeam to SVN. This is a pre-requisite for the Hanta Release Process


















SDK02 is overloaded with projects. We should look at migrating non-essential builds off, or moving our main build to another box.












Coordinate w/ John who can do the drudgery work 
But make sure no one else is doin work on it






Project Manager (primary contact): Lewis,D,Darren,XMM R 

The next free UK-mainland 44D number looks like 447800000326 (https://collaborate.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/Clickatell+Numbers+Assignment)

From a previous e-mail, it seems the number currently being used is 447624803068 which is mapped on the ListOfPeople page to
Steve Ball (steve.c.ball@bt.com) urn:uuid:e6408604-0c9e-4f63-ad25-5079c4e39b37

I can't see any reference to a mapping on the quarantine database (smsservice on port 5432) for either the appId or the uri.

Migrate project to the xfire/aop/spring products.












Migrate to XFire from Axis 1.3

We are facing issues with migrating to XFire. The xmlns attribute is not getting attached to all the elements. And hence the acceptance test cases fail.

Please note the Presence 1.0.0 version will have Axis 1.3 as the WS Toolkit






Migrate to XFire from Axis 1.3

We faced issues with migrating to XFire. The xmlns attribute is not getting attached to all the elements. And hence the acceptance test cases fail. This is to resolove that issue. 

-This has started working post the WSDL were changed to have the namespace same for the schema and the wsdl. Migrated the code to XFire using these new WSDL's and waiting for the fix from XFire.

Instead of using OpenSSL and System.Runtime() calls, we can use a container-based CA.

Wrapping openssl with os calls is brittle, is not thread safe, file-system based.

Supply call data in the following format:

<calls>
 <call>
 <call-status>ENDED</call-status>
 <call-time type="datetime">2007-10-02T16:13:50+02:00</call-time>
 <duration>156<duration> <gadget-id>8g0e9ewr97df6sd8e75f598e75gc78d</gadget-id>
 <name>Custom free text</name>
 <phone-callee>+441442787101</phone-callee>
 <phone-caller>+447918880881</phone-caller> <terminationcause>CallingPartyUnavailable</terminationcause>
 </call>
</calls>

Design Constraints:
Use RESTful uri
Data driven rules on namespace convention determined by data architect exercise (Helen)
Recursive pattern required to trverse nested parent-child assets 
bookmarkable links

Operation Constraints:






Actor: Customer Network Manager
Action : view the state of my services
Result : I can be more responsive to my customers

Notes:

Design Constraints:
Service/Network state information presented via XOA will be sourced from Agora only.

Operation Constraints:
Basic interaction model would be client-initiated pull via http-user-agent. More interactive, or scheduled state-updates woudl require client-side automation (i.e. ajax) or RSS/Aggregtor.

there is a requirement to add 2 new WS methods to Viper Core, for use in Portal they are ...

int[] FindDataCentre()
- returns a list of DataCentreId(int) from DataCentre table 

int[] FindGridByDataCentre(int)
- takes DataCentreId(int) 
- returns list of GridId(int) from Grid table where DataCentreId == inputed DataCentreId

See Email chain

-----Original Message-----
From: Ochsner,AM,Andrew,XSL3 R 
Sent: Wednesday, July 11, 2007 11:39 AM
To: Moser,P,Paul,XSL3 R; Breese,DD,Dustin,XSL3 R
Cc: Pearman,GL,Greg,XSL3 R; Conway,K,Ken,XSL3 R; Crews,JC,Jack,XSL3 R
Subject: RE: Question

Email address is not used in the cert, but there are no exposed methods to make changing anything possible other than the enabled/disabled status and the addCert/revokeCert... To keep things consistent, the best thing to do would be to create the new user in LDAP w/ the new email address, change the owner attribute of the application to the new email address, and also change the application email address to the new email address.

Here's the long story though...

There are 2 email addresses to be concerned about...owner email address and application email address. Currently, because of the way the portal decided to interact w/ AppReg, they are the same. Which is why, above, I say "to be consistent" and tell you to change both email addresses.

However, they don\u2019t need to be the same (in fact, in my opinion, they usually won't be). No one should really be using the owner email address except for maybe the Chit service which would want to send an email to the owner of the app that\u2019s going to run out of credits... Otherwise, services like WLA and others should use the Application Email address to send emails on the apps behalf (WLA does do this).

But again, not sure if anyone uses the owner email address when they should be using the application email address (because when looking at it they are the same).

ALSO, the LDAP structure is set up so that an application can have multiple owners...however, there are no exposed web service methods that would make that possible.

So, I think you're right...there's probably some sort of stories around people wanting to change application email addresses, as well as owners and owner email addresses. None of it is possible via the AppReg Web Service, however, they (the Denver team that I'm currently not on) are taking on AppReg stories in the next iteration, so lobby paul for prioritization of said stories

Andy O

-----Original Message-----
From: Moser,P,Paul,XSL3 R
Sent: Wednesday, July 11, 2007 10:29 AM
To: Ochsner,AM,Andrew,XSL3 R; Breese,DD,Dustin,XSL3 R
Subject: FW: Question

 
Andy, Dustin,

We've had a request, see below, to alter the email address used for an app. 

From my understanding of how things are put together the email address is used as the unique identifier of a user and goes into app reg, the certificate and possibly else where and so at present isn't vialble to change. Is this the case?

Going forward what what is the impact of a change of a users email address? I think under the terms of the Data Protection Act we'll need to be able to update this information, even if it doesn't fall foul of that it'll certainly bug people that they are unable to change their address.

Is the simple answer for the problem below for this instance just to get the user to register but using the new email address and we put that account into the VIP group?


Thanks,

Paul

At the moment everything is app authenticated against web21c services.  Service owners may not want this

For example Matrix capabilities may want their own auth domain with its own policies in place etc that all strategic capabilities share.






We currently have the notion of a credit based charging mechanism and as service owners we control that.

This is a value add service that our service owners may wish to exploit for themselves but would not wish to come under the charging regime we operate with

Currently, clicking on the "I've forgotton my details" link as an unactivated user just shows an error page.

At the very least, it needs to handle the error gracefully.

The SMS sent to aquire permission for tracking the location of a device should timeout if we do not recieve a reply within a configurable time period..

Background task to process any "PENDING" rows that are > 30 days (configurable) in the past to delete the SessionEntity.

Pro: Simple, easy to understand
Con: Trackee may be 'bothered' again by requests instigated by the tracker after the housekeep has been performed, and forced to respond NO, thus enforcing an unwanted cost.












As a customer I want to be able to call a number and receive my voicemail as text so that I can email/sms it to customers or blog it or whatever

Notes: This is complicated by the need to provision, some mechanism for the customer to come and pick up their text

They call us with number and desired recipients, we send their number to session, session calls it and says "please record your message", when complete send back to us with details of wav






As a customer I want to be able to pass a URL so that the service picks up my WAV files so that I don't have to send them

Notes: what protocol do we use? We don't need provisioning as we can get them to send us number (could be inbound sms so app gets it) and email in request.

From Stephen Rogers:

"Unfortunately this does cost us money as we send it on to Clickatell and they try to deliver it to that non-existent mobile and charge us for the effort. To check the connection and avoid costing money use easysms: http://web21c.bt.com/documentation/virtual_sms. You can do this as often as you like."

NOTE: currently still charging for these messages, otherwise we can't test that the credits are decreased. If we are going to publicly support easysms, we'll need to be more intelligent about it.

Option 1 (quick), 2 effort points:
\u2022 Add entry to existing config file that turns off/on the premium number blocking.
\u2022 If turned on, then a REGEX is used to exclude all numbers less than 6 digits (this covers 99.9% of all premium rate messaging). Note, if application owners are kicking up stick, then we can add their FREE short code to the same REGEX for inclusion.






Option 2 (harder), 6 effort points:
\u2022 Implement above solution except with a database instead of a config file.  DB would have exclusion and inclusion numbers in a table.
\u2022 An admin tool would be required for updating the exclusion/inclusion tables.






As a Tradespace admin, I want to be able to add regex patterns to a list of numbers that will not be called so that I can block expensive calls not blocked by the service (i.e. 09X numbers)

As a developer using the SDK I want to be able to create groups, move contacts to groups, invite contacts, accept invitations, reject invitiations, retrieve pending invites and get my roster list because these are the functionalities exposed from the Presence Roster service

As an austin admin I want to have the ability to change the amount that users are charged for the services offered so that I can alter the margins I make on the calls.

The Persona \u201cI\u201d is the developer outside of BT.


First I need the prices to be downloadable in a CSV file. That should be easy; folk are gonna want to load them in a database locally.

Second, if the prices are going to churn I need a really simple service, that i can access programmatically off the portal that allows me to do something like

GET http://web21c.bt.com/legprice/447740145813

And I get back a JSON or XML document of the leg cost.
Equally I would like to 
GET http://web21c.bt.com/legprice/447740145813&341234567&198232333 
So that i can get them back as an array (save hits on the web site too)

This service should be public, and not require authentication; the pricing info doesn\u2019t at the moment.

Third, every time there is the smallest of changes to pricing, I want an email \u2013 not rss \u2013 so that I can react fast.

Thanks
Tim

Acceptance criteria

1. Start and terminate a call from an http client with both applications running normally.

2. Initiate, terminate inbound call (xlite) with both applications running normally.

3. Show that calls hit both applications.

4. repeat #1 and #2 after shutting down one application gracefully.

5. Restart shutdown application and repeat #1 and #2

Investigate






As a mojo admin I want to know what to do when my database gets compromised so that I don't have huge problems later.

* For total compromise of our database:
Reset secret keys for all gadgets.

Possibly Email all users with registered email addresses warning that they need to re-authorise their gadgets and get new keys.

* Assuming we see risk that the hash of username/passwords has been compromised, Users who have got a password registered with mojo instead of an openid have their password reset to a random password, which is emailed to them. OpenId (only) users will not have this step, as we do not manage their passwords.

 
For compromise of a specific user account:

Reset secret keys for all gadgets related to compromised account. Possibly Email user if email address registered stating that they need to re-authorise their gadgets and get new keys.

If the user has a password registered, reset their password to a random password, which is emailed to them. This is not necessary if the user uses only their openId to log on.

For compromise of a specific gadget, or gadget reported as being \u2018dangerous\u2019:

- De-authorise gadget for all users.

- Remove gadget from gallery.

- Email registered users of gadget informing that it has been withdrawn.

- Consider action against \u2018owner\u2019 of gadget, i.e. block their account, or withdraw other gadgets provided by them depending on specifics of issue.

Most of this depends on having an email address and can be implemented using scripts / based on documentation / procedure.






WES heartbeat alerts should appear in Nagios for an integrated view, thus we only have one notification method.






To fix a bug where repeat tests return invalid phone number

...rather than the other way round.






When the user clicks the sign-in link,
then after signing in, the page the user was originally on should be rendered.






The code was ported from .Net 1.1, and is very difficult to maintain as the designer gets confused when regenerating the code behind. Further, the use of GDI+ means that all coordinates and sizes are hard coded, and do not scale well for enlarged resolutions, large fonts etc.

If substantial changes in the wizard are desired, a complete rewrite would be faster than working with the existing code.

Needs to make this simpler and more maintainable

AppReg code is currently too complex, and has too many layers.
Need to refactor to be simpler, and have specs for all but the
very lowest layer (which is as thin as possible) which talks
to the SOAP service.

Need to have better specs for models, controllers and views.
Still need to have integration tests that talk to real app-reg.
Need to have better Acceptance tests.






Refactor the availability service so that it uses the annotation validator (called against the delegate interface) for processing the input list objects. 






Refactor the SDK capability business logic layer to allow each of the capabilities to be deployed in their own dll.

Consider a Core assembly and various satellite assemblies for each capability.






Understand
Implement appropriate changes






-Remove all references to anything "revenue".
-Rename the database.
-Change package name from com.bt.capabilites.revenue to com.bt.capabilities.chit.












We need to refactor the Java SDK so that it has two distinct layers:


 - Service Facade
This layer makes the calls to the services and wraps our security and authentication around them. This layer should be as generic as possible and will be the primary thing we generate

 - Object Layer
This layer encapsulates services into O-O lifecycle objects. The objects call through to the Service Facade.






Available only to Corporate, SMS, Voice and legacy modules.






Stuf 4 fitnesse
wire in spring


















ie: convert this:

if (deviceId == null)
 throw new ArgumentNullException("deviceId",
 Resources.CannotBeNull);
 
if (deviceId.Length == 0)
 throw new ArgumentException(Resources.CannotBeEmpty,
 "deviceId");

into this:

ParameterValidation.StringNotNullOrEmpty(deviceId, "deviceId");


















Reject means only that something went wrong, not necessarily the same something that the test was expecting.






Refactor the Resources files so that the same resources are not c&p into every single project (very unagile!).

There needs to be a core set of resources, and each project can extend these if required, rather than duplicating.

There are many classes that have the word SMS in their title.

Now the SMS service is more generic and is simply called Messaging, we ought to refactor our code to match that.












Dealing with FxCop violations at compile time means there's less chance of badness staying in code. Further, we can have a passing QA build (at last)!






Remove the mis/integration/data-adapter module, which is now pointless and adds considerable complexity.

Actor: Customer Network Manager
Action : access my network data from both outside and inside my company firewall
Result : mobility

Notes:
Associated with the zero-client requirement, to ensure access to this information is not bound to any device, browser or application consumer.

Design Constraints:
Webby...
any auth not based on ip ranges - issues re NAIF/SAFE etc

Operation Constraints:
Local caching and offline working will have to be managed by the consumer (browser/ feed-reader/ aggregator)

This is from an error e-mail triggered by a BuyNet failure - credit card details were sent via e-mail to the sdk.alerts@bt.com address.

 * Parameters: {"registered_application_id"=>"urn:uuid:4ec45adb-248d-4e67-bdf4-f68f396ceee7", "commit"=>"Confirm", "payment_details"=>{"expiry_month"=>"5", "terms_and_conditions"=>"1", "card_type"=>"VISA", "card_holder"=>"Bob T Builder", "transaction_id"=>"070824-1448-17393-500", "card_number"=>"4111111111111111", "cv2"=>"012", "expiry_year"=>"2012"}, "action"=>"create", "controller"=>"credit_purchases", "credits"=>"500"}






The Location & IAM logic layer objects have parameterless constructors. We have no current use for these, as these require users to logon. So we should remove these to avoid confusion.

for discussion - ensure meaningful exceptions cover usage without pre-requisites. (Comments on param.less constructor)

NOTE: We are currently trying to use this attribute to bypass idp rules in sandbox for session capabilities.






Just the one is needed (where app knows it's group)






As a service owner I want to be able to remove content from my bookshelf so that I can manage my distributable


















Since it's not being called from Sentry, there won't be a transactionId or SAML so we don't need those handlers.  Also, the new transaction handler will throw faults if there isn't a transactionId (indication it wasn't called via Sentry) so we want to avoid that.  To get a transactionId, consider using the TransactionIdInterceptor from Revenue

this doesn't really fit in the logic layer. Remove caching and leave it to the components.






The Contacts and IAM forums are rdundant as that functionality is no longer supported






If we're moving to "credits", can we get rid of the pounds/pence confusion at the same time?

This code appears in user_transaction.rb, and is really nasty:

 #all interaction is in \u00a3s, but storage is in pence
 self.amount = self.amount * 100

If amount is ambiguous, it should be split into two separate named attributes.

Spike to find a replacement binding for JAXB in XFire that will work better with the webservices, and not produce 'JAXBElement'-like objects that are horrid to work with.

A good result would be finding something to replace JAXB that does not produce badness.

An acceptable result would be to know that there isn't anything out there that works better.

An alternative acceptable result would be to isolate the problem to Xfire rather than the binding.






This is Javaservlet on tomcat, to be moved to Krypton.

report on service count on hits per day






- Destination count to country (each call should have 2 entrys)
\u0009\u0009-Example
\u0009\u0009\u0009\u25a1 Pakistan 4
\u0009\u0009\u0009\u25a1 USA 400

Add the ability to specify the application id for queries, so that reports may be run for a particular application.


Eg: From Paul: "I want a report every week on the TFL certificate and how much they are using the services."

(Questions: - would anyone want aggregated results for a set of applications?  Maybe that is a separate story, if this behaviour is required).






Some "reports" currently consist of calculations such as the number of concurrent calls.

- Introduce a new area in the report set definition yaml, where the "calculation-type" queries are specified.
- An entry in this area of the yaml will correspond to a class in the reporting framework, which will run the appropriate query and do the calculation.
- The results of these queries will be in the body of the email generated.






Most existing reports are hard-coded to run the query only for the previous day.  Refactor these reports so that a time period can be specified, and the same query file can be used for daily, monthly, quarterly etc reports.






Many reports are hard coded to return the "top" 25 applications (eg, top 25 most expensive applications etc).

Refactor these so that "25" is not hard coded and the number required can be specified at run time.






Recieved Calls
TPCalls
