As per tasks






Calling services on sentry requires message parts to be signed with the developer's key.

Messages returned FROM sentry are signed by sentry on the return trip.

Subsequent calls to sentry require message parts to be re-signed with the developer's application key to prevent man-in-middle attacks.

_________________________________________________
Establish what is required and refactor samlclient(and/or) update wse policies to enable this.

http://www.codeproject.com/soap/WSE30UsernameAssertion.asp

When we switch call legs around in a call, or issue re-invites with hold descriptions, we need to adhere to the following rules specified in RFC 3264:

 If an SDP is offered, which is different from the previous SDP, the
 new SDP MUST have a matching media stream for each media stream in
 the previous SDP. In other words, if the previous SDP had N "m="
 lines, the new SDP MUST have at least N "m=" lines. The i-th media
 stream in the previous SDP, counting from the top, matches the i-th
 media stream in the new SDP, counting from the top. This matching is
 necessary in order for the answerer to determine which stream in the
 new SDP corresponds to a stream in the previous SDP. Because of
 these requirements, the number of "m=" lines in a stream never
 decreases, but either stays the same or increases. Deleted media
 streams from a previous SDP MUST NOT be removed in a new SDP;
 however, attributes for these streams need not be present.






Placemarker if we need to sort this stuff out. Look at wiki page for more details: https://collaborate.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/TODOs+for+RFC+Compliance

Raise by Downey: 
the service just hung for me this morning - didn't get a reply back in over 30 minutes - guess I need to implement a timeout, but it would be better if it just took my request and came back right away. 

Uros: Quite a number of these 'timeout' issues are actually caused by the network infra, something somewhere in the BT infra drops (or hangs) the odd request, usually before that request ever hits the service. We've had quite a few posts on this on the forum, but as yet our OI friends are unable to find the problem...

As for taking the request - although the SMS platform itself is meant to work in this way (taking the request from us and returning right away), experience of occasional delays suggests otherwise.

Acceptance: no client hang outs
 tests passing

There is an issue with the mapping within the SQLDriver class when column options are supplied. 






Investigated this one - yeah it was caused by one of our own tests - and its happening on CI as well but the tests still pass. It's to do with our table used to concatenate multi-part inbound messages. If we get duplicates (2 parts 1of2 and 1 part 2of2 for example) then the code works fine and it ignores the duplicate (1of2) and concatenates the message correctly (1of2 + 2of2) - but it does throw this exception as the table doesn't like duplicates.

Should we just ignore it? It's an unlikely scenario as no-one has asked for inbound SMS over 160 characters and it doesn't actually break the functionality.

We need to decide what Jabber server to use in Production (WildFire Vs EJabbered)

1. Ejabberd was configured on radon192, the CI box for presence.
2. CI was run against this instance of Ejabberd on 192.
3. A whole bunch of junits failed on the CI while talking with this EJabberd instance on CI.
4. Subsequently this story wass aborted as there were too many errors while running the junits on ejabberd. And it was considered too late to move to a new Jabber Server at this stage.

Solution Summary:
-Enable the existing archiving tasks that capture the incoming request into sentry and the outgoung response from sentry.
-Add 2 new archiving tasks to record outgoing request to the capability and the incoming response from the capability.
-Need to extend the sentry db.  More space is required. Calvin is already working on that. Time?
-Need MIS reporting database with sufficient longterm storage space.
-Need process by which the data can be transformed into something useful
-Need process by which the data in the sentry db can be deleted and disk space recovered, once the data is moved to the MIS db.

1. Configured two instance of wildfire 
2. Pointed the 2 instances to the same postgres instance.
3. There are problems in sharing the same postgres instance as some data is shared between the two instances and updating one updates the other.
4. The two wildfire instances will have a different domain name, domain1 and domain2 and hence users will have diff user ids as userid@domain1 and userid@domain2 which will lead to problems.

The SmsInbound component has currently a SendMessage method which allows to send a message to an inbound recipient. At the moment, this keyword have to be specified inside the same message text.

smsInbound.SendMessage(InboundKeyword + " " + "my text...", InboundPhonesNumber);

I think that should be nice to do add one more parameter named keyword, and remove that value from the text (even if everything is putting together behind scenes).

smsInbound.SendMessage(InboundKeyword, "my text...", InboundPhonesNumber);

Erich.






Improve the page to help drive intrest to it.

Specific issues:

<This is now limited to testing the 3rd party suppliers and not the ISDN 30 lines>

1. When ca third party call ends the call doesn't clear properly until the PSTN timeout so the phone can't be used for 3-6 mins

2. Call timers are wrong

3. If a PSTN user clears on a conference, after the PSTN timeout a "de da do the other user has cleared" message is played to the other conference participants

Acceptence: options for solving call clearing problems






                -based on heights in Designer ?
                -some kind of 'moveup/down function'

From: Casey,G,Gary,XSL1 R
Sent: 20 October 2006 08:54
To: Ramji,A,Al-noor,X R; Rangaswami,J,JP,JR R; Crookes,J,Jim,XSL R
Cc: Downey,P,Paul,XSL1 R
Subject: RE: Do we use live clipboard free from msft?


It's not so much "using" as supporting. Live Clipboard is
more interesting as a standard than as a tool.
 
I asked Paul Downey for more info, the rest of this reply is his:
 
I don't think we support it anywhere, as yet. But
all we have to do is annotate HTML data such as 
dates, appointments, contact info etc with 'standard' CSS 
(CSS the web standard, not CSS the big BT system)
names on BT.com, then people can scrape the data using 
tails (a firefox plugin), Ray Ozzies Live Clipboard thing, 
http://weblog.infoworld.com/udell/2006/03/16.html#a1407 

GRDDL (an XSLT registry for microformats) 
to turn BT pages into RDF .. 
http://www.w3.org/2004/01/rdxh/spec 

etc. etc. 

So we get coolness for little cost. Unfortunately there's not 
a lot of benefit beyoind the cool - it's not mass-market, yet, 
but it might be nice to be ahead of the game, esp if Microsoft 
are interested. And Yahoo switched flickr etc a while back: 
http://ylocalblog.com/blog/2006/06/21/we-now-support-microformats/ 

We could also consider trying to establish Microformat 'standards' 
for data such as a 'phone bill', in the way people have composed 
hCard, XFN etc microformats into hResume for CVs: 
http://microformats.org/wiki/hresume 

I say 'standards' because that's the beauty of them, they've 
very ad-hoc, but very widely agreed upon.

Currently, we don't.  We have to use NTCredentials() instead of UsernamePasswordCredentials().

I don't want to have to remember xxxxx.intra.bt.com I want to specify paul.karsten@gmail.com when I register.

1. On registration, we will continue to take in the bare userid i.e. only paul.karsten
2. Registration will continue to return the complete userid i.e. paul.karsten@domainname
3. Currently on signon we take the complete userid i.e. paul.karsten@domainname, will that change to just take the bare userid i.e. only paul.karsten?
4. In all the operations like invite,accept,decline,remove,change group,get pending invites,send chat message,receive chat messages and get/set directed presences we take in the complete userid as xyz@domainname, will that change to just take the bare userid i.e. only paul.karsten?
5. The method getRosterEntries returns the complete userids, will that change to return only the bare userid i.e. only paul.karsten?
6. The presence value object contains the username as the complete userid as xyz@domainname, will that change to return only the bare userid i.e. only paul.karsten?

We need a confirmation/impact from sdk on this story.

Email from George-

I would double check how you're doing database pooling in Location. As part of what we're doing in contacts I looked at the Hibernate docs on database connection pooling, and it confirmed that you shouldn't be using Hibernate's implementation for Database Connection pooling for production strength code (see http://www.hibernate.org/hib_docs/reference/en/html/session-configuration.html).

You should therefore use JBOSS, jakarta commons etc. for the JDBC datasource configuration.

As an example, Iam uses JBOSS. Contacts will use the jakarta commons DBCP API for the datasource pooling configuration.












Tidy up and understand the build process






We had a Forum post about these status conditions and when they occur.


So we had a closer look...  

1) If the called/calling party does not answer the phone then the callTerminationCause will be set to "CallTerminatedByController". This will be set after the time period specified in the dial timeout parameter. (i.e. the length of time the service will try to call a number before giving up). If not explicitly set this defaults to 10 seconds (by th SDK)

2) If the called/calling party is engaged then the callTerminationCause will be set to "CalledPartyUnavailable"/"CallingPartUnavailable". There is however a caveat to this. The Voice Call Service must receive the message from the telephone network indicating the line is busy BEFORE its own dial timeout kicks in. If does not then the callTerminationCause will be set to "CallTerminatedByController". [We carried out some tests that show it is taking about a minute for this message to come back from the PSTN Gateway]. Setting the dial timeout to a value of about 90 seconds should be enough to ensure the busy message is received from the phone network before the Voice Call service stops listening.

I think we could do with a new status to cover the scenario when a person doesn't pickup (if you want to distinguish it from them being engaged), either that or use the PartyUnavailable status. We do need to distinguish not answering from other scenarios that end up with CallTerminatedByController (e.g. endCall or exceeding max call duration). At the moment you can only tell that somebody didn't answer within the timeout by cross checking that the call duration is zero but you don't know who didn't answer (caller or callee).






                -Randomise Line Colours or Make them similar to source/target (?)
                -Redraw while moving dialogs
                -Highlight link lines when hovering

Nauman and Tim have discussed and are now proposing the following project structure (an example directory structure will be checked into svn soon):

/MIS
 MIS/extension (core ruby extensions)
 - object.rb, class.rb, kernel.rb, etc...
 MIS/deployment 
 - config.rb, config.yaml(?), etc...
 MIS/subjects (area specific model classes)
 MIS/subjects/usage
 MIS/subjects/usage/session
 MIS/subjects/usage/messaging
 MIS/subjects/cost
 MIS/subjects/cost/...?
 MIS/subjects/revenue
 MIS/subjects/revenue/...?
 MIS/integration
 MIS/integration/io (file_watcher.rb, etc...)
 MIS/integration/database (postgres.rb, etc...)
 MIS/integration/extension (config.rb, etc...)
 MIS/integration/loading (bulk_loader.rb, etc...)
 MIS/integration/extraction (database_extractor.rb, etc...) 
 MIS/lang
 MIS/lang/parsing (parser.rb, scanner.rb, etc...)
 MIS/lang/transformation (??? => code gen?)
 MIS/transformation (xfrms!)
 MIS/transformation/filtering












Essentially the problem is that it is possible to send a fake positive response to the Location service to falsify permission based on:-
a) Being able to spoof a text message without detection
b) The acceptance text being easily duplicated (i.e. "0 y").

The scenario is simple:-
1) HACKER requests permission to track CELEBRITY
2) CELEBRITY receives the request permission text but before they can respond HACKER sends an SMS spoofed from CELEBRITY's device to say 'yes'.
3) HACKER can now track CELEBRITY until CELEBRITY takes action to prevent this, assuming they even know this is happening.
4) Sunday 'red-top' expose follows soon after.

It was established early on from the SMS team that it is not possible to identify a 'spoofed' SMS. Although the SDK SMS service no longer allows the 'from' field to be set manually there is no guarantee that other SMS services will do likewise. And anyway, Clickatel offers no way to identify such a message.

Therefore it falls back on the Location service to defeat this scenario.

We came up with TWO main routes of defence, co-operating with each other to make the whole process reasonably watertight.
1) Make the response far more difficult to second-guess ('0 y' or '1 y' is too easy). It was suggested that the SessionId be made into a random 4-character alphanumeric value (short enough not to be too awkward, long enough to make random guessing relatively fruitless).
2). After 3 failed attempts the session is cancelled and the tracker must resubmit the request.

The implementation might be as follows.
1) The Permission message requires a response of, for example "C3PO y" to allow permission. (I suggest the text be case-insensisitve - although this lessenes the random element it is more user-friendly. We should also avoid I/1/O/0 chars perhaps.)
2) The SessionId is already a Varchar column able to hold alphanumeric data. We need a new INT column on SessionEntity - say 'failAttempts'. Each time a failed reponse is received on an active Session we increment this count. We will send a message to say that a reponse has been received but not accepted.
3) If the count hits 3 failed reponse attempts then we delete the SessionEntity to stop the dialog. We then send a message to say that 3 failed reponses have been recived and the proposed tracker now has to re-request permission.

We believe this scenario offers a good degree of protection whilst being reasonably straightforward to implement.

Currently the transactions page has a "Reference" which is an increasing number.

This should be a "random" value.

Could it be better if this was still an incrementing value, but seeded at a higher number? That way we wouldn't need a 'uniqueness' check for each value, any more than 'is greater than the last entry'

SMS currently sends all messages as Unicode which effectivly limits a message to 70 characters. As we advertise a message limit of 160 characters, this splits some messages into three actual sends. Create an ... more intelligent approach to handling message transmission

Scan message
Decide whether to unicode or not

Acceptance:
Acceptance: Fitnesse - one sends ascii text, one unicode, JUnit tests to prove if plain text only message sent as text and if any special characters message is sent as unicode






As a messaging capability I want to know if I can avoid translating to unicode so I am not hit with the 189 character limit

AMO


















1) Conferencing. The client will no longer set a fixed upper limit for the max participants in a conference call (which then allocates that number of ports on the media server). Port allocation on the media server will be handled dynamically within the conferencing service. There will be an overall maximum that cannot be exceeded to stop one person using all 200 ports! There may also be a new exception to handle the case when a new port cannot be allocated.

Conferencing WSDL
 
ConferenceInfo type: Remove maxNumberOfParticipants
 
createConference operation: Remove maxNumberOfParticipants input parameter
getConferenceInfo operation: Returns the updated ConferenceInfo type
 
 
ThirdPartyCall WSDL
 
Remove cancelCallRequest operation
(use the endCall() service instead)
 
Any issues anyone?






DotNetSDK build on sdk02 now uses the altered xsk, css and config to show th "BT BUILD" stuff.

Duplication checks have not been included, because checkstyle has insufficient merit.






Acceptance:
updated












The fitnesse tests are not currently repeatable and give different results on repeated runs.






1. Add unit/integration tests for testing 0, 1, many Roster entries.

2. Add fitnesse tests for testing 0, 1, many Roster entries.


















The SMS messaging.wsdl will remain unchanged !

However the functionality behind the wsdl will change in this. This WILL effect the Location service and MAY affect the sdks (not sure if they need to do anything).

Currently In the send message method in the wdsl looks like :-

sendMessage(to, applicationId, replyToUri, MessageText);

And the current behaviour is that the application id is used to validate if the internal caller(capability really) can use two way sms or not (i.e. Location).
Application id in the method call at the end of iteration 1(now) will not used and should be simply sent as null. Validation now is done by the application id field in SAML.
NOTE :- Location will have to change their call to SMS and make sure they send us proper SAML with the application id set.
NOTE :- The replyToUri field is currently not used in SMS for any functionality and this will remain the case in iteration 1.

Hence a valid call from the SDK or Location would look like :-
sendMessage(URI[recipients tel no's], null, null, "MessageText") - along with valid saml and saml application id set.
Any strings entered in place of null above will simply be ignored by the capability.

Currently the getReceivedMessages method is in the messaging.wsdl but this is not exposed externally by the sdk yet.
We would now like the SDK's to expose this method now if possible as the functionality in the capability is now implemented behind it to secure it for external use.

This means that Location again will have to use proper SAML with the application id set in this call also as we will use it for validation.
Also Location should call with their keyword parameter instead of the current registrationid eg. ( getReceivedMessages("LOC"); )






We will be refactoring the sendMessage method to take out unused parameters and possible exposing 2 sendMessage methods (one for one way SMS, one for 2 way SMS).
We will be changing the getReceivedMessages method by changing the parameter name.

So in iteration 2 this will invoke a change on the sdk's and Location obviously as the wsdl will be changing.


If you have any queries about this then contact Stephen Rodgers or myself to explain.






WSDL changes for Voice Call and Conference Call






Once the changes to the WLA WSDL have been approved:

Changed updateUser to changePassward.

Added createUser






















































All,

SMS are making a drop to 197 later today. The changes to expect are as follows:
\u2022\u0009No more timeouts/hanging. SMS will now always respond almost immediately but you will not be able to tell from the response whether it failed or succeeded. You need to check the message status for this.
\u2022\u0009Message length restriction changed. The limit is now 3 concatenated text messages. For normal text messages the limit is now 459 characters and for unicode (i.e. with special characters like "\u00a3") the limit is 189 characters.
\u2022\u0009The + problem with delivery status should now be resolved


Thanks
Stephen Rogers

to 1.1.5 on 197 and quarantine (at next release)

[1.1.5 has been confirmed as fixing a known problem. This was tested by creating a branch and upgrading ubiquity in 197] 

Need to upgrade trunk, upgrade dev & CI environments to 1.1.5. Do not upgrade production at this time as it is working fine. 

[URL off Pete Edwards (peter.3.edwards) wiki for 1.1.5 download]

A code change will also be required. With 1.1.3 we used to receive 1 callback when someone hangs up in 2-way call. We now receive 2 callbacks (one for each call leg). This causes a race condition when updating the call termination cause with either caller/ callee terminated the call. (Race condition caused by async events in a mutlithreaded environment). Need to re-visit how we handle these events. Could also get back to ubiquity.

Acceptance criteria:
All acceptance tests still pass
New tests for race condition?
Deliver to 197 and inform dependents






JIRA - 343

Acceptance - all tests still working

dep on what interfaces the saml assertionmanager lib being produced has we have either to
- change the smal assertion wrapper to delegate to the xfire message context. This is the case in which the data is set as attribute in the MC (eg userId, appCotnext, ...)

- change all the exposed method interfaces to call SamlAssertionWrapper.getInstance().setSamlAssertionManager passing the manager extracted from the MC attribute

either way we need to mod the signature of all the exposed method to include the XFire MC as an input parameter






Andy, George and Fav concluded some work with regards to SAML handling in the SDK and as a result of this a central helper will be developed. This work has been documented here http://engineering.intra.bt.com/confluence/display/PC/Sentry-Capability-SAML+Decoupling+-+Due+24+Aug

Use this approach to access SAML






Currently tel calls are sent as sip when used from callee / caller variables












This includes aspects, transaction Id in logging and access to SAML.

We need inbound and outbound logging.


















Maybe we should consider using a string representation based on 
http://ftp.ics.uci.edu/pub/ietf/http/related/iso639.txt
 
ala Java locale API, for example en_UK_female_1
 
<language code>_<dialect>_<gender>_<id>
 
<language code> should always be mandatory, <dialect> is optional and default to UK (or whatever), <gender> is optional and default to male, <id> is optional and default to 1.
 
Plus
- it makes sdk and service happy, 
- it's self documented, 
- it's generic enough to avoid wsdl changes, 
- it's standard and unlikely to change,
- it nicely integrates with i18n apps written in java (not sure about .net)
Minus
- it makes the Voice team itchy as we have already a big pile of stories in the backlog. But it's a one off change that does not require further maintainance.






If we can see if we can add some material around googles offering in this space






Mock phones are used to support voicecall testing. We now we should do the same for SMS.

We would require to test "successful" responses and possibly null repsponses. 






Announcements in 3pc are identified by a numeric value. The rationale for using them (over enums) is that new languages are supported without wsdl changes. But they are not expressive nor self documenting.

Maybe we should consider using a string representation based on 

http://ftp.ics.uci.edu/pub/ietf/http/related/iso639.txt

ala Java locale API, for example en_UK_female_1

<language code>_<dialect>_<gender>_<id>

<language code> should always be mandatory,
<dialect> is optional and default to UK, 
<gender> is optional and default to male,
<id> is optional and default to 1.

- it makes sdk and service happy, 
- it's self documenting, 
- it's generic enough to avoid wsdl changes, 
- it's standard and unlikely to change,
- it nicely integrates with i18n apps written in java (not sure about .net)

As a service owner I want to be able describe a release of SDK and distributable so that I can improve the experience of my users

We can set a limit to the number of versions available if necessary






The general versioning strategy is to have a SHARED file between projects. It contains an assembly attribute ( guess which one J ).Nant, like all other buld tools, knows this common strategy and so gives a task that allows you to create this file on the fly during a build. <version revisiontype="Increment" buildtype="Increment" path = "Versioning\Version.txt" /> <property name="core.version" value="${buildnumber.major}.${buildnumber.minor}.${CCNetLabel}.${buildnumber.revision}"/> <echo message="New build version : ${core.version}"/> <attrib file="..\src\Common\Version.cs" normal="true" /> <attrib file="Versioning\Version.txt" normal="true" /> <asminfo output="..\src\Common\Version.cs" language="CSharp"> <imports> <import namespace="System" /> <import namespace="System.Reflection" /> </imports> <attributes> <attribute type="AssemblyVersionAttribute" value="${corer.version}" /> <attribute type="AssemblyFileVersionAttribute" value="${core.version}" /> </attributes> </asminfo> You can see that we use CCNet label to ensure an automatic increment of build number that is also easy to see on our CC.NET tray JMajor and Minor are manually adjusted through a text file ( Version.txt ) as that is carefully controlled by our group based on decisions of what features are in the release, blah blah.






Tradespace would like to offer video conferencing.






Actor : Customer Network Manager
Action : view my network data by account
Result : I can constrain the amount of information i want to see

Notes:

Design Constraints:
Existence of relationships in agora schema.

Operation Constraints:






Actor: Customer Network Manager
Action : view my network data by application
Result : I can constrain the amount of information I want to see

Notes:

Design Constraints:
Relationships must exist in underlying datasource.
These are Services in the namespace

Operations Constraints:






Actor: Customer Network Manager
Action : view my network data by geography
Result : I can constrain the amount of information I want to see

Notes:

Design Constraints:
Relationships must exist within the underlying, nominated datasource.

Operations Constraints:






Actor: Administrator
Action : ability to provide differing views of data dependent on internal or external use.  
This must be achievable without interuption to the service.
Access must be web based
Result : ensure protection of business sensitive information

Notes:

Design Constraints:
internal and external 'aspects' ie uri configurations
internal and external resource representations (restrict sensitive info e.g. credit rating)

Operation Constraints:


















Actor : Customer Network Manager
Action : view the network related Services I am outsourcing to BT
Result : seamless access to my information

Notes:
could be uri-based filtering/scoping scheme, or basic user-profile settings relating to page-size in result-sets etc

Design Constraints:
Any parametric scheme introduced into the addressing scheme must remain pure in terms of rfc2616

Operation Constraints:

This story may require:
--> new recipient protocol = wap:447xxxxxxxxx; 
-> Config change, need more than one Clickatell URL: one for sending text messages, one for sending wap push
--> New NAIFs/SAIFs for new wap push Clickatell url?


Other than above, there are at least 2 options:
</###################################################
(1) WAP PUSH, URL IN MESSAGE TEXT:-
Overview:
--> If wap message, then grep for 1st URL in text, copy and pass onto Clickatell. Other URLs are ignored.
--> Message text including the wap URL will also be pushed across in the message text


Pro:
--> No WSDL change
--> Use existing WSDL parameters as-is, e.g., eventing url will work with wap: as with tel:, sip:, etc.

Con:
--> We're going to have to get our hands dirty with SDK amendments. Maybe now is the time to do it...

USER STORY EFFORT: 6
###################################################/>

</###################################################
(2) WAP PUSH, URL AS NEW WSDL PARAMETER:-
Overview:
--> New WSDL operation with wapUrl, e.g., http://blah/blah/blah.
--> SDK amendments, code, portal changes, etc.


Pro:
--> ???

Con:
--> Bigger effort

USER STORY EFFORT: 6 for wap code change. 10 for SDK/Portal changes?

###################################################/>

As a developer I DON\u2019T want to have to login every x minutes to refresh SAML tokens. I want to timeout after inactivity only. So I would like the SDK to monitor activity, and if I have made a request within x minutes I would like the SDK to renew the SAML assertions in the background. I would also like (optional) to be able to find the time when the assertions will timeout.

So that our customers get the same service as using Clickatell






As a product owner I want to be able to offer Wholesale's outbound SMS so that I can address confusion of offerings available within BT

With the initiation of the MUM capability there is some confusion as to which of the available SMS services to use. One could consider them alternatives of the same product - with Wholesale's being ultra secure and guaranteed delivery but expensive and ours being lighter weight and cheaper.

By fronting both we may realise more traffic and consumption from internal projects. It would certainly reduce confusion






When I am my own buddy I am always off-line.

This story goes into Backlog.












As a widget developer I want to advertise my widget on the mojo website so that people will use my widget.

Acceptance:

Users can add their widget to a gallery

* assumes is a link and some information / comments / description / image






As a user I want to rate widgets I've used so that other users can see what widgets are good and what widgets aren't.

Acceptance:

User can rate a widget from 1-5 stars
Widget's average rating, number of users and number of votes are displayed in widget gallery






As a user I want widgets to have a name so that on my statement I can see which widget I used my credits on

Acceptance:

Widgets have a name
Statement shows which widget was used

*assumes that I don't care if someone spoofs the name






As an widget developer I want to see how much usage my widget has had so that I can see how successful I am

Acceptance:

Widget developer can see number of calls made using widget for previous month
Widget developer cannot see individual call records
Widget developer can see number of distinct users for previous month

* assumes I don't care about spoofing

Wiki






The Windows Installer XML (WiX) is a toolset that builds Windows installation packages from XML source code. The toolset provides a command line environment that developers may integrate into their build processes to build MSI and MSM setup packages.

Actor: Customer Network Manager
Action : not have to install client software
Result : re-use existing zero/low cost generic client software

Notes:
We don't build application front-ends for the resources we are exposing (by default).

Design Constraints:
html : browser based - for UI
rss/atom : feed reader - for UI
xml/json ... - for automation
pdf/csv .. report based

Operation Constraints:
Volume constraints may be placed on rss/atom feeds in respect of potential network-related feed requirements.

Acceptance: 
 
User 1 in Dick's app -> send User 2 DA
User 2 in Dick's app <- receive User 1's message
User 2 in Dick's app -> send User 1 DA
User 1 in Dick's app <- receive User 2 DA

User 1 -> send User 2 + 3
User 2 -> send User 1
User 3 -> send User 1
User 4 <- receive 0
User 1 <- receive 2 messages (distinct)

Security Tests

User 1 @ DA cannot <- receive User 1 @ TA

http://mashable.com/2007/08/15/freewebs-redesign/






[I'm sure this is done! --PSD]

I'd expect for a gadget to appear on the gallery it must have been written by a mojo user - there's a user "mojo"
for the gadgets we seed.

One of the parameters to a call being the gadget id, if missing it's assumed to be "anonymous" which could be switched off by default.

A user has to enable a gadget to be able to make calls using his account.

Each gadget gets its own key/secret to allow a user to
 - identify which gadget made a call
 - minimise the impact of a rogue gadget
 - switch an individual gadget off

and us to identify and possibly reward authors of the most popular gadgets.

In the .Net SDK for Web21C there are objects of the same name but if different namespaces (e.g. BT.Sdk.Locate.Location and BT.Sdk.Components.Location).  This in itself doesn't cause problems, but there is only one GeoLocation object, so if I use the Component but need the GeoLocation object I need both namespaces and have to fully qualify the objects which makes the code smell.

Could either have duplicate objects is more then one namespace using inheritence or change the names.

- Robbie

From: Lieven Iliano [mailto:lieven@u2u.net] 
Sent: 16 November 2006 18:05
To: Jaussoin,A,Antoine,XSL3 R
Subject: RE: BT SDK

 

I think I have found the error. I have used reflector to dissamble the executable. The problem is located in the BT.SDK.Utilities.WSE3PolicyGenerationWizard.CertificateWizardHelper.GetCertificates() method.

public static Dictionary<string, X509Certificate2> GetCertificates()
{
      Dictionary<string, X509Certificate2> dictionary1 = new Dictionary<string, X509Certificate2>();
      X509Store store1 = new X509Store(StoreName.My, StoreLocation.CurrentUser);
      store1.Open(OpenFlags.ReadOnly);
      foreach (X509Certificate2 certificate1 in store1.Certificates)
      {
            string text1 = null;
            if (certificate1.Subject.Length > 60)
            {
                  text1 = certificate1.Subject.Substring(0, 60);
                  text1 = text1.Substring(0, text1.LastIndexOf(','));
                  text1 = text1 + "...";
            }
            else
            {
                  text1 = certificate1.Subject;
            }
            dictionary1.Add(text1, certificate1);
      }
      return dictionary1;
}
 

In Belgium we all have an electronic identity card that contains 2 certificates, one for authentication and one for authorization. The first 60 characters of the subject of these certificates are the same for each person. So this tool will crash on each computer that has the Belgium eid certificates installed. The fastest work around is to surround the add method with an if statement like this:

if (!dictionary1.ContainsKey(text1))

{

    dictionary1.Add(text1, certificate1);

}

 

 

The best way of course is to use the serial number of the certificate as the key in the dictionary.












as a developer i want the Location capability to mantain and persist sms sessions used to implement permissions and registration stories so that when the capability is redeployed the sessions are still open and usable.
-----
until now sms sessions were stored in memory. this caused loss of data once location was redeployed. That meant that all open sessions (for example sms requests not yet responded) were lost, causing data inconsistency and not-so-good user experience






determine the location of the clients pfx file from a property.

We are adding the scenario as a listener to the OutgoingCallLegBean at the same time as another thread is trying to deliver an event to another instance of the Scenario. 

 

This causes a java.util.ConcurrentModificationException

 

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
 at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.checkForComodification(AbstractList.java:449)
 at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.next(AbstractList.java:420)
 at com.bt.sdk.callcontrol.sip.eventing.EventDispatcher.filterListeners(EventDispatcher.java:39)
 at com.bt.sdk.callcontrol.sip.eventing.EventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(EventDispatcher.java:63)
 at com.bt.sdk.callcontrol.sip.eventing.EventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(EventDispatcher.java:56)
 at com.bt.sdk.callcontrol.sip.dialog.outbound.OutboundDialogSipBeanImpl$2.execute(OutboundDialogSipBeanImpl.java
:127)
 at com.bt.sdk.callcontrol.sip.util.ConcurrentUpdateManagerImpl.executeConcurrentUpdate(ConcurrentUpdateManagerIm
pl.java:26)
 at com.bt.sdk.callcontrol.sip.dialog.outbound.OutboundDialogSipBeanImpl.processInitialInviteErrorResponse(Outbou
ndDialogSipBeanImpl.java:135)

This could be a bug in SSS worth fixing?

 

But, if we revert the singleton model for the scenarios, it'll probably go away as well.

 












all components need to support multi threaded environment.






-\u0009WSDL blessing tool.  Yes this again.  I can explain the reasons, but after some thought, I do think it is needed.  This will serve two purposes.  
o\u0009We will have people with existing WSDL\u2019s who need them exposed who have nothing other than that WSDL etc etc\u2026
o\u0009It adds a buffer layer before these people come to us or whomever is supporting external exposure at that point.
o\u0009It should be a simple UI that uploads and then gives a RAG status, any meaning behind the status is gravy.
o\u0009It should most likely be on the existing page Nathan developed.






Discuss with paul D & bubba
Spike distro model






/***
|''Name:''|SparklinePlugin|
|''Description:''|Sparklines macro|
***/
//{{{
if(!version.extensions.SparklinePlugin) {
version.extensions.SparklinePlugin = {installed:true};

//--
//-- Sparklines
//--

config.macros.sparkline = {};
config.macros.sparkline.handler = function(place,macroName,params)
{
	var data = [];
	var min = 0;
	var max = 0;
	var v;
	for(var t=0; t<params.length; t++) {
		v = parseInt(params[t]);
		if(v < min)
			min = v;
		if(v > max)
			max = v;
		data.push(v);
	}
	if(data.length < 1)
		return;
	var box = createTiddlyElement(place,"span",null,"sparkline",String.fromCharCode(160));
	box.title = data.join(",");
	var w = box.offsetWidth;
	var h = box.offsetHeight;
	box.style.paddingRight = (data.length * 2 - w) + "px";
	box.style.position = "relative";
	for(var d=0; d<data.length; d++) {
		var tick = document.createElement("img");
		tick.border = 0;
		tick.className = "sparktick";
		tick.style.position = "absolute";
		tick.src = "data:image/gif,GIF89a%01%00%01%00%91%FF%00%FF%FF%FF%00%00%00%C0%C0%C0%00%00%00!%F9%04%01%00%00%02%00%2C%00%00%00%00%01%00%01%00%40%02%02T%01%00%3B";
		tick.style.left = d*2 + "px";
		tick.style.width = "2px";
		v = Math.floor(((data[d] - min)/(max-min)) * h);
		tick.style.top = (h-v) + "px";
		tick.style.height = v + "px";
		box.appendChild(tick);
	}
};


}
//}}}






/***
|''Name:''|DeprecatedFunctionsPlugin|
|''Description:''|Support for deprecated functions removed from core|
***/
//{{{
if(!version.extensions.DeprecatedFunctionsPlugin) {
version.extensions.DeprecatedFunctionsPlugin = {installed:true};

//--
//-- Deprecated code
//--

// @Deprecated: Use createElementAndWikify and this.termRegExp instead
config.formatterHelpers.charFormatHelper = function(w)
{
	w.subWikify(createTiddlyElement(w.output,this.element),this.terminator);
};

// @Deprecated: Use enclosedTextHelper and this.lookaheadRegExp instead
config.formatterHelpers.monospacedByLineHelper = function(w)
{
	var lookaheadRegExp = new RegExp(this.lookahead,"mg");
	lookaheadRegExp.lastIndex = w.matchStart;
	var lookaheadMatch = lookaheadRegExp.exec(w.source);
	if(lookaheadMatch && lookaheadMatch.index == w.matchStart) {
		var text = lookaheadMatch[1];
		if(config.browser.isIE)
			text = text.replace(/\n/g,"\r");
		createTiddlyElement(w.output,"pre",null,null,text);
		w.nextMatch = lookaheadRegExp.lastIndex;
	}
};

// @Deprecated: Use <br> or <br /> instead of <<br>>
config.macros.br = {};
config.macros.br.handler = function(place)
{
	createTiddlyElement(place,"br");
};

// Find an entry in an array. Returns the array index or null
// @Deprecated: Use indexOf instead
Array.prototype.find = function(item)
{
	var i = this.indexOf(item);
	return i == -1 ? null : i;
};

// Load a tiddler from an HTML DIV. The caller should make sure to later call Tiddler.changed()
// @Deprecated: Use store.getLoader().internalizeTiddler instead
Tiddler.prototype.loadFromDiv = function(divRef,title)
{
	return store.getLoader().internalizeTiddler(store,this,title,divRef);
};

// Format the text for storage in an HTML DIV
// @Deprecated Use store.getSaver().externalizeTiddler instead.
Tiddler.prototype.saveToDiv = function()
{
	return store.getSaver().externalizeTiddler(store,this);
};

// @Deprecated: Use store.allTiddlersAsHtml() instead
function allTiddlersAsHtml()
{
	return store.allTiddlersAsHtml();
}

// @Deprecated: Use refreshPageTemplate instead
function applyPageTemplate(title)
{
	refreshPageTemplate(title);
}

// @Deprecated: Use story.displayTiddlers instead
function displayTiddlers(srcElement,titles,template,unused1,unused2,animate,unused3)
{
	story.displayTiddlers(srcElement,titles,template,animate);
}

// @Deprecated: Use story.displayTiddler instead
function displayTiddler(srcElement,title,template,unused1,unused2,animate,unused3)
{
	story.displayTiddler(srcElement,title,template,animate);
}

// @Deprecated: Use functions on right hand side directly instead
var createTiddlerPopup = Popup.create;
var scrollToTiddlerPopup = Popup.show;
var hideTiddlerPopup = Popup.remove;

// @Deprecated: Use right hand side directly instead
var regexpBackSlashEn = new RegExp("\\\\n","mg");
var regexpBackSlash = new RegExp("\\\\","mg");
var regexpBackSlashEss = new RegExp("\\\\s","mg");
var regexpNewLine = new RegExp("\n","mg");
var regexpCarriageReturn = new RegExp("\r","mg");

}
//}}}
